name: University Grants Commission National Eligibility Test
description: A national-level exam conducted in India to determine eligibility for the roles of assistant professor and Junior Research Fellowship (JRF). It aims to ensure minimum standards for teaching and research positions. The exam is organized by the University Grants Commission (UGC).

name: Joint Entrance Examination Mains
description: An all-India entrance exam for admission to undergraduate engineering programs at NITs, IIITs, and other institutions. It also serves as a qualifier for JEE Advanced, the gateway to IITs. The exam assesses candidates' knowledge in physics, chemistry, and mathematics.

name: Indian Institute of Foreign Trade
description: An autonomous institute in India specializing in international business and trade education. It offers MBA programs and conducts its own entrance exam for admissions. The institute is known for its focus on global trade and economics.

name: Council of Scientific and Industrial Research
description: The Council of Scientific and Industrial Research is a premier R&D organization in India. It conducts innovative research in various scientific domains such as aerospace, energy, and healthcare. CSIR also conducts the NET exam for science disciplines.

name: Indian Police Service
description: The Indian Police Service is one of the three All India Services responsible for public safety and order. IPS officers serve in various capacities, including crime prevention, traffic control, and disaster management. They are recruited through the Civil Services Examination.

name: National Defence Academy
description: The National Defence Academy is a joint military academy in India training cadets for the Army, Navy, and Air Force. It provides rigorous physical, academic, and leadership training. Admission is through a competitive national-level exam.

name: Bhabha Atomic Research Centre
description: The Bhabha Atomic Research Centre is India's leading nuclear research and development institution. It works on advanced atomic science, nuclear reactors, and radiation technology. BARC also plays a vital role in India's nuclear energy program.

name: Bharat Electronics Limited
description: Bharat Electronics Limited is a state-owned enterprise specializing in electronic equipment for defense and civilian use. It produces advanced radar systems, communication devices, and weapons systems. BEL also contributes to space and healthcare technologies.

name: Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited
description: Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited is a government-owned oil and gas company in India. It is involved in refining, marketing, and distributing petroleum products. BPCL plays a crucial role in ensuring the country's energy security.

name: Defence Research and Development Organisation
description: The Defence Research and Development Organisation develops advanced technologies for India's defense forces. It works on missile systems, radar, and combat vehicles. DRDO's innovations strengthen the country's strategic and operational capabilities.

name: Indian Council of Medical Research
description: The Indian Council of Medical Research is the apex body for biomedical research in India. It focuses on health research to address public health challenges. ICMR promotes evidence-based policies and innovations in medicine.

name: Gramin Dak Sevak
description: Gramin Dak Sevak positions are part of the rural postal network under India Post. GDS personnel manage postal operations in villages, including mail delivery and financial services. They play a vital role in connecting rural areas to the postal system.

name: Indian Oil Corporation Limited
description: Indian Oil Corporation Limited is India's largest government-owned oil corporation. It refines crude oil, produces petroleum products, and markets them across the country. IOCL also explores renewable energy solutions and petrochemicals.

name: Indian Space Research Organisation
description: The Indian Space Research Organisation is India's national space agency, pioneering space exploration and satellite technology. It conducts satellite launches, planetary missions, and space research. ISRO contributes significantly to communication, navigation, and earth observation.

name: Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited
description: The Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited manages nuclear power generation in the country. It designs, constructs, and operates nuclear reactors. NPCIL ensures the safe and efficient use of nuclear energy for electricity generation.

name: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation
description: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation is a government-owned company exploring and producing oil and gas in India. It plays a key role in meeting the country's energy demands. ONGC also invests in renewable energy and petrochemical production.

name: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation
description: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation is responsible for constructing and operating the metro rail system in Delhi and NCR. It provides a safe, reliable, and eco-friendly public transport system. DMRC is known for its advanced technology and efficient operations.

name: Rail India Technical and Economic Service
description: Rail India Technical and Economic Service is a government enterprise offering technical consultancy for transportation infrastructure. It specializes in railways, highways, and urban transport. RITES also provides project management and export services.

name: Railway Protection Force
description: The Railway Protection Force ensures the safety of railway passengers, assets, and property in India. It handles crime prevention, disaster management, and rescue operations on railway premises. RPF personnel maintain law and order in the railway network.

name: Kishore Vaigyanik Protsahan Yojana
description: The Kishore Vaigyanik Protsahan Yojana is a scholarship program encouraging students to pursue careers in science and research. It identifies talented young minds through an aptitude test and interviews. Selected students receive financial support for their education.

name: National Talent Search Examination
description: The National Talent Search Examination is a scholarship program identifying and nurturing academically talented students in India. It is conducted in two stages and evaluates reasoning and scholastic skills. Successful candidates receive scholarships for higher studies.

name: National Eligibility cum Entrance Test
description: The National Eligibility cum Entrance Test is a medical entrance exam in India for admissions to MBBS, BDS, and other medical courses. It assesses candidates' knowledge in physics, chemistry, and biology. NEET is the gateway to medical colleges across the country.

name: Indian Post
description: India Post is the country's postal system providing mail and financial services. It connects urban and rural areas through its vast network of post offices. Services include mail delivery, savings accounts, and remittance facilities.

name: India Post Payments Bank
description: India Post Payments Bank is a government-owned bank offering digital and financial services through the postal network. It aims to promote financial inclusion in rural and semi-urban areas. IPPB provides services like savings accounts, bill payments, and remittances.

name: National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development
description: The National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development supports rural development and agriculture in India. It provides credit facilities, infrastructure development, and policy guidance. NABARD also promotes self-help groups and sustainable development.

name: State Bank of India
description: The State Bank of India is the largest public sector bank in India, offering banking and financial services. It provides personal and corporate banking, loans, and investment solutions. SBI also has an extensive global presence.

name: Staff Selection Commission
description: The Staff Selection Commission conducts exams to recruit candidates for various government posts. It organizes exams like SSC CGL, CHSL, and MTS. SSC plays a crucial role in the selection of skilled professionals for ministries and departments.

name: Central Industrial Security Force
description: The Central Industrial Security Force is a central armed police force in India responsible for the security of industrial establishments, government buildings, and critical infrastructure. It plays a vital role in disaster management and provides VIP security.

name: Central Armed Police Forces (Assistant Commandants) Examination
description: The Central Armed Police Forces (Assistant Commandants) Examination is a recruitment exam for entry-level officer positions in India's paramilitary forces. It evaluates leadership, physical fitness, and analytical abilities.

name: Union Public Service Commission
description: The Union Public Service Commission is responsible for conducting exams for civil services in India. It conducts the Civil Services Examination for selecting IAS, IFS, IPS officers and other central government services.

name: Andhra Pradesh Public Service Commission
description: Andhra Pradesh Public Commission is the state government agency responsible for conducting recruitment exams and selecting candidates for civil service roles and other state government positions.

name: Andhra Pradesh State Level Police Recruitment Board
description: Andhra Pradesh State Level Police Recruitment Board handles recruitment for police department roles in Andhra Pradesh. It conducts exams and physical tests for positions like constables, sub-inspectors, and other police staff.

name: Board of Intermediate Education Andhra Pradesh
description: The Board of Intermediate Education Andhra Pradesh regulates and supervises intermediate education in the state. It is responsible for setting the syllabus, conducting exams, and managing admissions to junior colleges.

name: Directorate of Medical Education Andhra Pradesh
description: The Directorate of Medical Education Andhra Pradesh oversees medical education, training, and research in the state. It manages medical colleges, nursing schools, and paramedical institutions, ensuring quality standards in healthcare education.

name: Bihar Public Service Commission
description: Bihar Public Service Commission is a state agency responsible for conducting competitive exams and selecting candidates for various administrative and civil service posts in Bihar government departments.

name: Bihar Staff Selection Commission
description: Bihar Staff Selection Commission is tasked with recruiting eligible candidates for non-gazetted positions in various state government departments through competitive exams and selection processes.

name: Bihar Police Subordinate Services Commission
description: Bihar Police Subordinate Services Commission conducts recruitment exams for police-related posts, such as sub-inspectors and other subordinate roles in the Bihar Police Department.

name: Bihar Combined Entrance Competitive Examination Board
description: Bihar Combined Entrance Competitive Examination Board conducts entrance exams for admission into professional courses such as engineering, medical, and agricultural programs in Bihar.

name: Bihar State Cooperative Bank
description: Bihar State Cooperative Bank manages recruitment for roles in cooperative banks across the state and oversees the cooperative banking sector's operational and administrative needs.

name: Bihar School Examination Board
description: Bihar School Examination Board organizes secondary and senior secondary school examinations in Bihar, along with entrance exams for teacher eligibility and other educational activities.

name: Public Health Engineering Department
description: The Public Health Engineering Department in Bihar is responsible for planning, designing, and executing water supply and sanitation projects to ensure safe drinking water and proper hygiene in rural and urban areas.

description: Bihar Technical Service Commission handles recruitment for technical and specialized posts in state government departments, such as engineers, medical professionals, and other technical roles.

name: Bihar Energy Department
description: The Energy Department of Bihar oversees power generation, distribution, and policies related to electricity in the state. It focuses on ensuring reliable energy supply and managing renewable energy initiatives.

description: The High Court of Gujarat is the highest judicial authority in the state of Gujarat. It oversees legal matters, including the recruitment of judicial officers and administrative staff within the judicial system.

description: The Gujarat Public Service Commission is responsible for conducting competitive exams to recruit candidates for various administrative services, including civil services, engineering, and educational positions in the state government.

name: Gujarat Urja Vikas Nigam Limited
description: Gujarat Urja Vikas Nigam Limited is the state-owned company responsible for the transmission and distribution of electricity in Gujarat. It also manages the recruitment of various roles within the state's energy sector.

name: Paschim Gujarat Vij Company Limited
description: Paschim Gujarat Vij Company Limited is a subsidiary of GUVNL, responsible for the distribution of electricity in the western regions of Gujarat. It oversees the recruitment of staff for its operations and customer service functions.

description: Madhya Gujarat Vij Company Limited is another subsidiary of GUVNL, responsible for power distribution in central Gujarat. It handles the recruitment of employees for various roles in the electricity distribution process.

description: Gujarat Energy Transmission Corporation Limited is responsible for the transmission of electricity in Gujarat. It recruits professionals for various roles related to energy transmission, grid maintenance, and operations.

description: Gujarat State Electricity Corporation Limited is a state-owned power generation company in Gujarat. It is involved in the recruitment of engineers, technicians, and other professionals for the generation of electricity.

description: Bank of Baroda is one of India's leading public sector banks, headquartered in Gujarat. It recruits for various banking roles, including clerks, officers, and managers across its nationwide branches.

description: Common Entrance Test is a standardized exam conducted for admissions to various undergraduate and postgraduate courses in different fields such as engineering, medical, and management in Rajasthan.

description: Rajasthan State Electricity Board is responsible for electricity generation, transmission, and distribution in Rajasthan. It recruits staff for technical and administrative roles in the power sector.

description: Rajasthan State Livelihoods Development Corporation (RSLDC) is an initiative by the Government of Rajasthan aimed at providing employment and skill development opportunities to the youth of Rajasthan through various training and livelihood programs.

name: Online Job Application System
description: Online Job Application System (OJAS) is a portal managed by the Gujarat government for online applications, recruitment notifications, and exam details for various government jobs in Gujarat state. It provides services such as application submission, hall ticket download, and result announcements.

description: A state-level examination conducted by the Government of Andhra Pradesh to assess the eligibility of candidates for teaching positions in primary and upper primary schools.

description: A state-level entrance exam conducted for admission to engineering, pharmacy, and agriculture courses in Maharashtra.

description: A state-level eligibility test for Assistant Professor recruitment in Maharashtra and Goa.

description: A state-level entrance exam for admission into diploma courses in polytechnic institutions in Uttar Pradesh.

description: A state-level examination to assess the eligibility of candidates for teaching positions in Uttarakhand.

name: Himachal Pradesh Teacher Eligibility Test
description: HPTET is a state-level examination conducted by the Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education (HPBOSE) to assess the eligibility of candidates for teaching positions in primary (Classes 1–5) and upper primary (Classes 6–8) schools in Himachal Pradesh. Qualifying HPTET is mandatory for aspiring teachers in government and private schools within the state.

name: Indian Rare Earths Limited
description: A recruitment drive conducted by Indian Rare Earths (IREL) for 30 executive-level positions across various domains, including finance, HR, engineering, and business development. Candidates with relevant educational qualifications such as B.Tech/B.E, CA, MBA, and M.Sc can apply. The selection process involves a written test and/or personal interview.

name: Indian Army
description: The Indian Army is the land-based branch of the Indian Armed Forces, responsible for maintaining national security and defending the country's borders. It conducts recruitment drives for various ranks, including officers, soldiers, and technical personnel, through exams like NDA, CDS, and direct entries. The selection process typically includes written exams, physical tests, medical evaluations, and personal interviews.

name: Indian Navy
description: The Indian Navy is the naval branch of the Indian Armed Forces, tasked with safeguarding maritime interests and national security at sea. It recruits personnel for various roles, including officers, sailors, and technical staff, through entry schemes like NDA, CDS, and direct recruitment. Selection involves written exams, physical fitness tests, medical evaluations, and interviews.

name: Indian Air Force
description: The Indian Air Force (IAF) is responsible for securing Indian airspace and conducting aerial warfare during conflicts. It offers recruitment opportunities for pilots, ground duty officers, and airmen through exams like AFCAT, NDA, and CDS. The selection process includes written exams, aptitude tests, medical evaluations, and physical assessments.

name: Engineering Projects India Limited
description: A recruitment drive conducted by Engineering Projects India Limited (EPIL) for 48 managerial positions across various domains, including engineering, legal, finance, and management. Candidates with qualifications such as B.Tech/B.E, LLB, CA, and MBA/PGDM can apply online. The selection process involves a written test and/or personal interview.

name: Railway Recruitment Board
description: The Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) is responsible for recruiting personnel for various technical and non-technical posts in Indian Railways. This recruitment drive is for 9970 ALP (Assistant Loco Pilot) positions. Candidates with qualifications such as Any Graduate, Diploma, and ITI can apply. The selection process includes written exams, medical tests, and document verification.

name: National Bank for Financing Infrastructure and Development
description: The National Bank for Financing Infrastructure and Development (NaBFID) is a financial institution established to provide long-term financial assistance for infrastructure projects. The recruitment drive is for 4 officer-level positions. Eligible candidates with a Diploma, Post Graduate qualification, or CA can apply. The selection process involves interviews and document verification.

name: North Eastern Indira Gandhi Regional Institute of Health and Medical Sciences
description: The North Eastern Indira Gandhi Regional Institute of Health and Medical Sciences (NEIGRIHMS), based in Shillong, Meghalaya, is a leading healthcare and educational institute in northeastern India. It is renowned for providing advanced medical services, quality education in medicine and nursing, and fostering research. It stands as a symbol of excellence, dedicated to improving healthcare in the region.

name: Institute of Banking Personnel Selection
description: IBPS (Institute of Banking Personnel Selection) is an autonomous body that conducts recruitment exams for various banking positions in public sector banks in India. Established in 1975, IBPS was created with the aim of providing a standardized and efficient selection process for banking jobs. The IBPS exam are highly competitive and serves as a gateway for candidates aspiring to work in the banking sector; to secure positions such as Probationary Officers (PO), Clerks, Specialist Officers (SO), and Officers in Regional Rural Banks (RRBs).

name: Reserve Bank of India
description: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is the central bank of India, established in 1935 under the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934. It serves as the regulatory body for the Indian banking system and is responsible for managing the country's currency and monetary policy. The RBI's primary functions include conducting consolidated supervision of the financial sector, regulating commercial banks, and ensuring financial stability in India. The bank was originally privately owned but was nationalized in 1949 and is headquartered in Mumbai.

name: Indian Coast Guard
description: The Indian Coast Guard (ICG) is a maritime law enforcement and search and rescue agency operating under the Ministry of Defence, Government of India. Established on August 18, 1978, it is responsible for protecting India’s maritime interests and enforcing maritime law in the territorial waters and Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ). Its primary roles include coastal security, search and rescue operations, anti-smuggling, environmental protection, and maritime surveillance. The ICG operates independently but works in coordination with the Indian Navy, police, and customs authorities. It plays a vital role in ensuring national security and maritime safety.

name: Airports Authority of India
description: The Airports Authority of India (AAI) is a statutory body under the Ministry of Civil Aviation, established in 1995 by merging the International Airports Authority of India and the National Airports Authority. It is responsible for creating, upgrading, maintaining, and managing civil aviation infrastructure in India. AAI oversees the operations of domestic and international airports across the country, provides Air Traffic Management (ATM) services, and ensures the safety and efficiency of air navigation. Headquartered in New Delhi, AAI plays a key role in enhancing air connectivity and supporting the growth of the aviation sector in India.

name: India Exim Bank
description: The Export-Import Bank of India (Exim Bank) is a specialized financial institution established in 1982 under the Export-Import Bank of India Act, 1981. It is wholly owned by the Government of India and operates under the Ministry of Finance. Exim Bank's primary role is to promote and finance Indian exports and facilitate international trade by offering financial products and services to Indian exporters and overseas buyers. The bank also supports Indian companies in their global expansion through loans, guarantees, and advisory services. Headquartered in Mumbai, Exim Bank plays a crucial role in strengthening India's international trade presence.

name: National Green Tribunal
description: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) is a specialized judicial body established in 2010 under the National Green Tribunal Act, 2010, for effective and expeditious disposal of cases relating to environmental protection and conservation of forests and other natural resources. It is a statutory body under the Central Government and functions under the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change. NGT deals with civil cases involving environmental laws, provides relief and compensation for damages to persons and property, and aims to reduce the burden of litigation in higher courts. The tribunal is headquartered in New Delhi and has regional benches across the country.

name: Industrial Development Bank of India
description: IDBI Bank, originally established in 1964 as a development finance institution, was transformed into a full-service commercial bank in 2004. It operates under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Finance, Government of India. IDBI Bank offers a wide range of financial services including retail and corporate banking, SME lending, and investment services. Although it was initially wholly owned by the Government of India, a majority stake was later acquired by the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC). Headquartered in Mumbai, the bank plays a significant role in supporting industrial and economic development in the country.

name: Punjab and Sind Bank
description: Punjab and Sind Bank is a government-owned public sector bank, founded in 1908 and nationalized in 1980. It operates under the Ministry of Finance, Government of India, and offers a wide range of banking and financial services including retail banking, corporate banking, agricultural banking, and loan services. The bank is known for its strong presence in northern India, especially in Punjab. Headquartered in New Delhi, Punjab and Sind Bank plays a key role in promoting financial inclusion and supporting economic development through its network of branches and digital services.

name: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited
description: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) is a premier aerospace and defense public sector undertaking established in 1940 and headquartered in Bengaluru, India. It operates under the administrative control of the Ministry of Defence, Government of India. HAL is primarily engaged in the design, development, manufacture, and maintenance of aircraft, helicopters, engines, avionics, and related systems. It plays a critical role in India's defense preparedness and self-reliance in aerospace technology, collaborating with organizations like ISRO, DRDO, and international defense agencies. HAL also supports civilian aviation needs through its technical expertise.

name: Balmer Lawrie & Co. Ltd.
description: Balmer Lawrie & Co. Ltd. is a Mini-Ratna Category-I Public Sector Enterprise established in 1867 and headquartered in Kolkata, India. It operates under the administrative control of the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, Government of India. Balmer Lawrie is a diversified conglomerate with core businesses in industrial packaging, greases and lubricants, travel and tourism, logistics, and chemicals. Over the years, it has evolved into a professionally managed, multi-location organization serving various sectors across India. The company plays a significant role in providing industrial solutions and logistics support for both public and private enterprises.

name: National Capital Region Transport Corporation
description: The National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC) is a joint venture company of the Government of India and the states of Haryana, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, and Delhi.

name: National High-Speed Rail Corporation Limited
description: NHSRCL is a government organization responsible for implementing high-speed rail projects in India, including the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train corridor. It works under the Ministry of Railways and aims to introduce cutting-edge rail technology to the country. The organization handles planning, construction, and execution of all high-speed rail infrastructure and services.

name: Central Pollution Control Board
description: CPCB is a statutory organization under the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change, Government of India. It is responsible for monitoring and controlling pollution in air and water across the country. CPCB also advises the central government on environmental policies and ensures compliance with environmental laws and standards.

name: THDC India Limited (Tehri Hydro Development Corporation India Limited)
description: THDC India Limited is a leading power sector and profit-making Public Sector Enterprise, registered as a Public Limited Company in July 1988 under the Companies Act, 1956. It primarily focuses on hydroelectric and renewable energy projects across India. Conferred with Mini Ratna Category-I status in October 2009 and upgraded to a Schedule 'A' PSU in July 2010, THDCIL operates under the Ministry of Power, Government of India.

name: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited
description: HPCL is a Maharatna Central Public Sector Enterprise under the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, Government of India. It is primarily engaged in refining, marketing, and distribution of petroleum products across the country. With a strong presence in the oil and gas sector, HPCL plays a vital role in India’s energy infrastructure and fuel security.

name: IRCON International Limited
description: IRCON International Limited is a Navratna Public Sector Undertaking under the Ministry of Railways, Government of India. Established in 1976, it specializes in engineering and construction services for transport infrastructure projects, including railways, highways, bridges, tunnels, and electrification. With operations in over 31 countries, IRCON has completed more than 1,650 major infrastructure projects in India and over 900 internationally.

name: NTPC Green Energy Limited
description: NTPC Green Energy Limited (NGEL) is a wholly owned subsidiary of NTPC Limited, India’s largest power generation company. Established to spearhead NTPC’s renewable energy initiatives, NGEL is focused on the development, ownership, and operation of green energy projects including solar, wind, and hybrid power across the country. It plays a key role in achieving India’s clean energy targets and reducing carbon emissions by supporting the transition from conventional to renewable sources. NGEL operates under the Ministry of Power, Government of India, and is headquartered in New Delhi.

name: Narcotics Control Bureau
description: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) is the apex drug law enforcement and intelligence agency of India, established in 1986 under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985. It operates under the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India. NCB is responsible for combating drug trafficking and the abuse of illegal substances by coordinating with state governments, central agencies, and international organizations. It also provides training, intelligence sharing, and technical support to various law enforcement bodies. The bureau is headquartered in New Delhi with zonal offices across major cities in India.

name: Metallurgical & Engineering Consultants Limited
description: MECON Limited is a Central Public Sector Enterprise under the Ministry of Steel, Government of India. Established in 1959, it is a leading engineering, consultancy, and contracting organization that provides a wide range of services in the fields of metallurgy, mining, power, oil and gas, infrastructure, and other industrial sectors. Headquartered in Ranchi, Jharkhand, MECON offers end-to-end solutions including project management, design, procurement, construction, and commissioning. The company plays a key role in supporting India’s industrial development and is known for its technical expertise and project execution capabilities.

name: IIFCL Projects Limited
description: IIFCL Projects Limited (IIFCL PL) is a wholly owned subsidiary of India Infrastructure Finance Company Limited (IIFCL), a Government of India enterprise under the Ministry of Finance. Established to provide advisory and project development services, IIFCL PL supports infrastructure projects across sectors such as transportation, energy, water, and urban infrastructure. It specializes in Public-Private Partnership (PPP) frameworks, financial structuring, and project appraisal, playing a crucial role in accelerating infrastructure development in India. The company operates with the objective of improving the quality and viability of infrastructure projects through professional advisory support.

name: Neyveli Lignite Corporation
description: NLC India Limited, formerly known as Neyveli Lignite Corporation Limited, is a Navratna Public Sector Enterprise under the administrative control of the Ministry of Coal, Government of India. Established in 1956, NLC is engaged in lignite mining and power generation, including thermal and renewable energy. Headquartered in Neyveli, Tamil Nadu, the company plays a vital role in meeting India’s energy demands and advancing clean energy initiatives. NLC has diversified into solar and wind energy, aligning with the nation’s commitment to sustainable development and environmental conservation.

name: Agricultural Scientists Recruitment Board
description: The Agricultural Scientists Recruitment Board (ASRB) is an autonomous organization under the Department of Agricultural Research and Education (DARE), Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Government of India. Established in 1973, ASRB is responsible for the recruitment of scientists and research professionals for the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) and its affiliated institutes. It conducts national-level competitive examinations and interviews to ensure merit-based selection for various scientific and academic positions. Headquartered in New Delhi, ASRB plays a key role in strengthening agricultural research and education in India.

name: Employees' State Insurance Corporation
description: The Employees' State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) is a statutory body under the Ministry of Labour and Employment, Government of India. Established in 1952 under the Employees' State Insurance Act, 1948, ESIC provides social security and health insurance to Indian workers. It offers benefits such as medical care, sickness benefits, maternity benefits, and disability compensation to employees and their dependents. ESIC operates a large network of hospitals and dispensaries across India and plays a vital role in promoting workers’ welfare and labor rights. Its headquarters is located in New Delhi.

name: Border Security Force
description: The Border Security Force (BSF) is one of India's Central Armed Police Forces, established in 1965 under the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India. It is responsible for guarding India’s land borders during peacetime and preventing transnational crimes such as smuggling and infiltration. BSF plays a key role in maintaining national security and participates in internal security duties, disaster response, and UN peacekeeping missions. With its motto 'Duty Unto Death', BSF is the world's largest border guarding force and is headquartered in New Delhi.

name: Central Institute of Petrochemicals Engineering & Technology
description: Central Institute of Petrochemicals Engineering & Technology (CIPET) is an autonomous institute under the Ministry of Chemicals and Fertilizers, Government of India. It focuses on education, training, and research in the field of plastics engineering and technology.

name: International Centre for Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology
description: The International Centre for Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology (ICGEB) is an international organization under the United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO), focusing on genetic engineering and biotechnology research.

name: Indian Maritime University
description: Indian Maritime University (IMU) is a central university under the Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways, Government of India. It offers education and training in maritime studies, research, and related disciplines.

name: National Institute of Technology Patna
description: National Institute of Technology Patna (NIT Patna) is an autonomous engineering and technology institute in Patna, Bihar, India. It offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs in various engineering disciplines.

name: Income Tax Department of India
description: Income Tax Department (ITD) is the apex body for administration of direct taxes in India, under the Department of Revenue, Ministry of Finance, Government of India.

name: RailTel Corporation of India Limited
description: RailTel Corporation of India Limited (RCIL) is a Mini-Ratna (Category-I) public sector enterprise under the Ministry of Railways. It provides broadband and VPN services, and is one of the largest neutral telecom infrastructure providers in the country.

name: Rail Vikas Nigam Limited
description: Rail Vikas Nigam Limited (RVNL) is a public sector undertaking under the Ministry of Railways. It is responsible for the implementation of railway infrastructure projects and modernization of railways in India.

name: Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation
description: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) is a subsidiary of Indian Railways that handles catering, tourism, and online ticketing operations for the Indian Railways.

name: Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited
description: Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation of India Limited (DFCCIL) is a public sector undertaking under the Ministry of Railways. It is responsible for planning, development, and mobilization of financial resources for the construction of dedicated freight corridors.

name: Andhra Pradesh District Selection Commission
description: AP DSC (Andhra Pradesh District Selection Committee) is a state-level recruitment examination conducted by the Government of Andhra Pradesh to hire qualified candidates for teaching positions in government schools. The exam is held for posts like School Assistants, Secondary Grade Teachers (SGT), Language Pandits, and Physical Education Teachers (PET) in various government, Zilla Parishad, Mandal Parishad, and municipal schools across the state.

name: Competition Commission of India
description: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) is a statutory body established under the Competition Act, 2002 to promote and sustain fair competition in the Indian market. It aims to prevent anti-competitive practices, protect the interests of consumers, and ensure freedom of trade. The CCI investigates mergers, acquisitions, and abuse of dominant positions to maintain a healthy economic environment and foster innovation and efficiency in the marketplace.

name: State Health Society
description: State Health Society, Bihar (SHS Bihar) is a government body under the Department of Health, Government of Bihar, responsible for implementing and managing various public health programs and schemes, primarily under the National Health Mission (NHM). Its aim is to improve the health infrastructure, maternal and child health services, and access to quality healthcare across the state.

name: Noida Metro Rail Corporation
description: Noida Metro Rail Corporation (NMRC) is a government organization responsible for rapid transit in Noida and Greater Noida regions of Uttar Pradesh, India. It operates under the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs.

name: Digital India Corporation
description: The Digital India Corporation (DIC) is a government body responsible for accelerating the digital transformation of India. They have announced a recruitment for 15 posts including Business Analyst, Product Manager, and more in 2025. The positions are available on a contract/consolidated basis with various educational qualifications required.

name: Dredging Corporation Of India
description: Dredging Corporation of India (DCI) is a public sector company engaged in dredging and marine infrastructure development services in India and globally.

name: Institute of Hotel Management, Catering Technology and Applied Nutrition, Hajipur
description: The Institute of Hotel Management, Catering Technology and Applied Nutrition, Hajipur (IHM Hajipur) is a premier hospitality education institution established in 1998. It functions under the Ministry of Tourism, Government of India, and is affiliated with the National Council for Hotel Management and Catering Technology (NCHMCT), Noida. The institute offers undergraduate and diploma programs in hospitality and hotel administration.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Patna
description: The Indian Institute of Technology Patna (IIT Patna) is a public research university located in Bihta, Bihar, India. Established on August 6, 2008, by an Act of the Indian Parliament, it is recognized as an Institute of National Importance by the Government of India. IIT Patna offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in various fields of engineering, science, and technology through its ten academic departments. The institute's permanent campus spans over 550 acres and has been fully operational since 2015.

name: Bhartiya Pashupalan Nigam Limited
description: Bhartiya Pashupalan Nigam Limited (BPNL) is a private sector company working in the field of animal husbandry in India. Established in 2009, BPNL aims to provide employment opportunities and promote livestock development by offering training and marketing support for animal products. The organization conducts various recruitment drives for roles such as Animal Health Worker, Sales Assistant, and other field-level positions.

name: Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board
description: Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSEB) conducts and regulates GSEB HSC and GSEB SSC exams across Gujarat. Get the latest updates on GSEB Result 2025, GSEB latest news, exam schedules, syllabus changes, and more. Stay informed with real-time announcements and resources for GSEB students and parents.

name: Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education
description: The Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education (MPBSE) is the official education board responsible for conducting and regulating MP Board Class 10th and 12th exams. It publishes MP Board results, academic notifications, and syllabus updates. Students can access MPBSE result 2025, latest news, and official announcements on mpbse.nic.in and related portals.

name: National Investigation Agency
description: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) is the central counter-terrorism law enforcement agency of India. Established under the National Investigation Agency Act, 2008, it operates under the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India. The NIA is tasked with investigating and prosecuting offenses related to terrorism, national security, and other threats affecting the sovereignty and integrity of the country. It has the authority to conduct investigations across India without prior approval from state governments. The agency is headquartered in New Delhi and has branch offices in various cities to ensure nationwide coverage and coordination in counter-terrorism and other national security-related investigations.

name: Department of Food and Public Distribution
description: The Department of Food and Public Distribution (DFPD) operates under the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution, Government of India. It is responsible for ensuring food security through the procurement, storage, movement, and distribution of food grains across the country. DFPD manages the Public Distribution System (PDS), which provides subsidized food grains to the economically weaker sections of society. The department also oversees the Food Corporation of India (FCI) and implements policies related to food grain management, sugar, and edible oils.

name: Central Water Commission
description: The Central Water Commission (CWC) is a premier technical organization in India in the field of water resources. Established in 1945, it functions as an attached office of the Ministry of Jal Shakti, Government of India. The CWC is responsible for initiating, coordinating, and furthering schemes related to the control, conservation, and utilization of water resources throughout the country. Its functions encompass flood control, irrigation, navigation, drinking water supply, and hydroelectric power development. The Commission is structured into three main wings: Designs and Research (D&R), River Management (RM), and Water Planning and Projects (WP&P), each overseen by a full-time Member with the status of Ex-Officio Additional Secretary to the Government of India. The CWC also operates 14 regional organizations across India to ensure effective coordination with state governments.

name: National Small Industries Corporation
description: The National Small Industries Corporation (NSIC) is a Government of India enterprise established in 1955 under the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME). It aims to promote and support the growth of micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) across India. NSIC provides a range of services including marketing support, credit facilitation, technology assistance, and skill development to enhance the competitiveness of MSMEs. The corporation operates through a nationwide network of offices and technical centers, offering schemes such as the Single Point Registration Scheme (SPRS), Performance & Credit Rating, and the National SC-ST Hub. NSIC also facilitates raw material procurement, organizes training programs, and assists in export marketing to empower small enterprises.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Bombay
description: The Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IIT Bombay) is a premier public research university located in Powai, Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. Established in 1958 with assistance from UNESCO and the Soviet Union, it was the second IIT to be founded and is recognized as an Institute of National Importance by the Government of India. IIT Bombay offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs across various disciplines, including engineering, science, design, and management. The institute is renowned for its cutting-edge research, innovation, and entrepreneurship initiatives, consistently ranking among the top engineering institutions globally. Its 550-acre urban campus houses 15 academic departments, 36 multidisciplinary centers, and several schools of excellence, fostering a vibrant academic and research environment.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur
description: The Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur (IIT Kanpur) is a premier public research university located in Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, India. Established in 1959, it is recognized as an Institute of National Importance by the Government of India. IIT Kanpur offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs across various disciplines, including engineering, science, humanities, and management. The institute is renowned for its cutting-edge research, innovation, and entrepreneurship initiatives, consistently ranking among the top engineering institutions globally. Its 1,055-acre urban campus houses 18 academic departments and several interdisciplinary programs, fostering a vibrant academic and research environment.

name: Central Council for Research in Ayurvedic Sciences
description: The Central Council for Research in Ayurvedic Sciences (CCRAS) is an apex autonomous organization under the Ministry of AYUSH, Government of India, dedicated to the formulation, coordination, development, and promotion of research on scientific lines in the Ayurveda and Sowa-Rigpa systems of medicine. Established in 1978, CCRAS operates a network of 30 institutes across India, focusing on clinical research, pharmacological studies, drug standardization, and medicinal plant research. The council aims to develop safe and effective Ayurvedic formulations and therapies for the management of diseases of national and global importance, validate classical Ayurvedic formulations, and disseminate research outcomes to promote evidence-based Ayurveda.

name: MSME Technology Centre, Indo German Tool Room
description: The MSME Technology Centre, Indo German Tool Room (IGTR) is a premier institution established in 1990 through a collaboration between the Government of India, the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany, and the Government of Maharashtra. Operating under the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME), it serves as a center of excellence in tooling and training solutions. IGTR  offers comprehensive services including design, manufacturing, and consultancy for SMEs, supported by advanced CNC machines and technologies. The center specializes in precision tooling, rapid prototyping, and 3D manufacturing for both metal and plastic components. It is certified under multiple ISO standards and focuses on skill development and technology transfer to enhance the capabilities of small and medium enterprises.

name: National Aluminium Company Limited
description: National Aluminium Company Limited (NALCO) is a Navratna Central Public Sector Enterprise under the Ministry of Mines, Government of India. Established on 7th January 1981, with its registered office in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, NALCO is one of the largest integrated Bauxite-Alumina-Aluminium-Power complexes in India. The company operates a 68.25 lakh TPA Bauxite Mine and a 21.00 lakh TPA Alumina Refinery at Damanjodi in Koraput district, and a 4.60 lakh TPA Aluminium Smelter along with a 1200 MW Captive Power Plant at Angul, Odisha. NALCO has regional sales offices in Delhi, Kolkata, Mumbai, Chennai, and Bangalore, and operates multiple stockyards across the country to facilitate domestic marketing. The company is recognized as the lowest-cost producer of metallurgical grade alumina and bauxite in the world, as per Wood Mackenzie reports. NALCO is also a significant exporter, with export earnings accounting for a substantial portion of its turnover.

name: Northern Coalfields Limited
description: Northern Coalfields Limited (NCL) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Coal India Limited (CIL), operating under the Ministry of Coal, Government of India. Established in 1985, NCL is headquartered in Singrauli, Madhya Pradesh. The company operates ten highly mechanized open-cast coal mines in the Singrauli coalfield, which spans parts of Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh. NCL is a significant contributor to India's coal production, supplying a substantial portion of its output to power plants across the country. The company is also involved in various community development and environmental sustainability initiatives.

name: Indian Institute of Technology Madras
description: The Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IIT Madras) is a premier public technical and research university located in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India. Established in 1959 with assistance from the Government of West Germany, it is one of the oldest and most prestigious IITs in India. IIT Madras is recognized as an Institute of National Importance and consistently ranks among the top engineering institutions in the country. It offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in various fields of engineering, sciences, management, and humanities. The campus spans approximately 620 acres and is known for its lush greenery and diverse wildlife.

name: Bureau of Indian Standards
description: The Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) is the national standards body of India, established under the BIS Act 1986 and functioning under the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food & Public Distribution, Government of India. BIS is responsible for the development and implementation of national standards to ensure quality, safety, and reliability of products and services. It also provides certification to manufacturers and laboratories through various schemes such as ISI mark and Hallmark. BIS plays a vital role in consumer protection, industrial development, and export promotion.

name: Bureau of Civil Aviation Security
description: The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) is the regulatory authority for civil aviation security in India. It functions under the Ministry of Civil Aviation and is responsible for laying down standards and measures related to the security of civil flights at international and domestic airports in India. BCAS ensures the implementation of security policies, conducts inspections and audits, and provides training to security personnel. It plays a key role in safeguarding civil aviation operations against acts of unlawful interference.

name: Indian Institute of Management Tiruchirappalli
description: The Indian Institute of Management Tiruchirappalli (IIM Tiruchirappalli or IIM Trichy) is an autonomous public business school located in Tiruchirappalli, Tamil Nadu, India. Established in 2011 by the Government of India, it is one of the newer IIMs but has quickly gained a reputation for academic excellence and industry engagement. The institute offers postgraduate, doctoral, and executive education programs in management. Its state-of-the-art permanent campus spans over 175 acres and supports a vibrant academic and research environment.

name: Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways
description: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways is a branch of the Government of India responsible for formulating and administering policies related to ports, shipping, and inland waterways. It oversees the development and regulation of major ports, promotes maritime trade, and facilitates infrastructure development through initiatives like the Sagarmala Project. The ministry also ensures safety, security, and sustainability in maritime operations and supports India's blue economy growth.

name: Department of Telecommunications
description: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) is a department under the Ministry of Communications, Government of India. It is responsible for policy formulation, licensing, regulation, and coordination of telecommunications services across the country. DoT oversees telecom service providers, spectrum management, infrastructure development, and the promotion of indigenous telecom manufacturing under initiatives like BharatNet and Make in India. It plays a crucial role in ensuring secure, accessible, and affordable telecom services to all citizens.

name: Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad
description: The Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad (IIM Ahmedabad or IIMA) is one of India's premier business schools, located in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. Established in 1961, it is renowned for its excellence in management education, research, and leadership development. IIMA offers a wide range of programs including the flagship Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGP), executive education, and doctoral programs. The institute is known for its rigorous academic environment, case-based pedagogy, and strong industry interface. IIMA has been consistently ranked among the top management institutes in India and Asia.

name: Physical Research Laboratory
description: The Physical Research Laboratory (PRL) is a premier research institution located in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India. Established in 1947 by Dr. Vikram Sarabhai, PRL is an autonomous unit of the Department of Space, Government of India. It is recognized as the cradle of space sciences in India and conducts fundamental research in various scientific domains, including Astronomy and Astrophysics, Solar Physics, Planetary Science and Exploration, Space and Atmospheric Sciences, Geosciences, Theoretical Physics, Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics, and Astro-chemistry. PRL operates observatories such as the Udaipur Solar Observatory and the Mount Abu InfraRed Observatory, contributing significantly to India's space and scientific endeavors.

name: National Water Development Agency
description: The National Water Development Agency (NWDA) is an autonomous society under the Ministry of Jal Shakti, Government of India, established in July 1982. It was set up to carry out detailed studies, surveys, and investigations concerning the Peninsular Component of the National Perspective Plan for Water Resources Development. NWDA's primary objective is to promote the interlinking of rivers in India to optimize the utilization of water resources, enhance irrigation, generate hydroelectric power, and mitigate floods and droughts. The agency conducts feasibility studies, prepares Detailed Project Reports (DPRs), and coordinates with various state governments for implementing interlinking projects.

name: Deendayal Port Authority
description: Deendayal Port Authority (DPA), formerly known as Kandla Port Trust, is a major seaport located in Kutch district, Gujarat, India. Established in 1952, it is one of the largest ports in India by cargo volume. The port serves as a vital gateway for trade in the western region, handling a diverse range of cargo including crude oil, coal, grains, and chemicals. DPA operates multiple terminals and is strategically positioned to cater to the needs of North, West, and Central India. The port has undergone significant modernization and expansion to enhance its capacity and efficiency.

name: Bihar Rural Livelihoods Promotion Society
description: Bihar Rural Livelihoods Promotion Society (BRLPS), popularly known as JEEViKA, is an autonomous body under the Department of Rural Development, Government of Bihar. Established in 2007, it serves as the State Rural Livelihoods Mission under the National Rural Livelihoods Mission (NRLM) framework. BRLPS aims to alleviate poverty and empower rural communities by promoting sustainable livelihood opportunities. The program focuses on social and economic empowerment of the rural poor, especially women, through the formation of Self-Help Groups (SHGs), Village Organizations (VOs), and Cluster-Level Federations (CLFs). Operating across all 534 blocks in Bihar, JEEViKA has mobilized over 1.3 crore rural families into more than 10 lakh SHGs. The initiative also implements various programs like the Bihar Kosi Flood Recovery Project and collaborates with organizations to enhance legal awareness and support among rural women.

name: Central Bank of India
description: Central Bank of India (CBI) is a public sector bank headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra. Established on 21 December 1911 by Sir Sorabji Pochkhanawala, it was the first Indian commercial bank that was wholly owned and managed by Indians. The bank offers a wide range of financial services including retail banking, corporate banking, and treasury operations. As of June 2024, Central Bank of India operates over 4,600 branches and more than 3,600 ATMs across India, serving millions of customers. The bank is majority-owned by the Government of India, holding a 93.08% stake. It has played a significant role in India's banking history, including being one of the first banks to issue credit cards in collaboration with Visa in 1980. The bank continues to be a key player in India's financial sector, focusing on inclusive banking and digital transformation.

name: Union Bank of India
description: Union Bank of India (UBI) is a prominent public sector bank headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra. Established on 11 November 1919, the bank has grown significantly over the years. On 1 April 2020, it amalgamated with Andhra Bank and Corporation Bank, becoming one of the largest public sector banks in India. As of December 2024, Union Bank of India operates over 8,574 branches and 9,087 ATMs, serving more than 153 million customers. The bank offers a comprehensive range of financial services, including consumer and corporate banking, investment banking, mortgage loans, private banking, and wealth management. It also has an international presence with branches in Hong Kong, Dubai, Antwerp, and Sydney, and representative offices in Shanghai, Beijing, and Abu Dhabi. The Government of India holds an 83.49% stake in the bank.

name: Patna High Court
description: The Patna High Court is the High Court of the state of Bihar, India. Established on 3 February 1916 by the British colonial government, it was created under the Government of India Act 1915. The court is headquartered in Patna, the administrative capital of Bihar. The foundation stone of the High Court building was laid on 1 December 1913 by Viceroy Sir Charles Hardinge, and the building was inaugurated on 3 February 1916. The court commenced its judicial functions on 1 March 1916, with Sir Edward Maynard Des Champs Chamier serving as its first Chief Justice. Initially, the Patna High Court had jurisdiction over the territories of Bihar and Orissa until 26 July 1948, when a separate High Court was established for Orissa. The court's jurisdiction was further adjusted following the creation of the state of Jharkhand in November 2000. The Patna High Court exercises jurisdiction over the state of Bihar and has the authority to issue writs under Article 226 of the Constitution of India. The court has played a significant role in the development of the Indian judiciary and has been instrumental in upholding the rule of law in the region.

name: High Court of Andhra Pradesh
description: The High Court of Andhra Pradesh is the highest judicial authority in the state of Andhra Pradesh, India. Originally established in 1954 with its principal seat at Guntur, the court was relocated to Hyderabad in 1956 following the merger of Andhra State and Hyderabad State to form Andhra Pradesh. Post the bifurcation of Andhra Pradesh in 2014, the High Court of Judicature at Hyderabad served as the common High Court for both Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. Subsequently, a separate High Court for Andhra Pradesh was established on 1 January 2019, with its principal seat at Amaravati. The court exercises original, appellate, and extraordinary jurisdiction over the state and comprises a sanctioned strength of 37 judges.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Mangalagiri
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Mangalagiri is a premier public medical institution located in the Mangalagiri-Tadepalli Municipal Corporation area of Guntur District, Andhra Pradesh. Established in 2018 under the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana (PMSSY), it is one of the 'Phase-IV' AIIMS institutes aimed at correcting regional imbalances in quality tertiary healthcare and medical education. The institute commenced its academic session in 2018 with 50 MBBS students at a temporary campus and began operations at its permanent campus in March 2019. As of the 2020–21 academic year, the MBBS intake increased to 125 students. The campus spans 183 acres and includes outpatient and inpatient services, with a 960-bed hospital offering a range of specialties. AIIMS Mangalagiri is committed to providing affordable tertiary healthcare and training future healthcare professionals.
